summary: Email chain between federal prosecutors and a victim services coordinator regarding the notification of victims in the Jeffrey Epstein criminal case (USA v. Jeffrey Epstein, Docket 19-CR-00490). The discussion focuses on logistical challenges in contacting victims, including the need for email addresses and the fact that many victims already have legal representation. The arraignment is scheduled for the upcoming Monday.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the criminal case USA v. Jeffrey Epstein, referenced in the email chain's subject line and body.

events.title: Epstein Arraignment Scheduled
events.description: The arraignment for Jeffrey Epstein in case 19-CR-00490 is scheduled for Monday, July 15, 2019, prompting urgency in victim notification.

locations: 1 St. Andrews Plaza, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: The email chain is part of the case USA v. Jeffrey Epstein, Docket 19-CR-00490, indicating active federal prosecution in July 2019.
Prosecutors are working to notify victims of the case, but face challenges as only one victim on their list has a known email address.
Many victims already have legal representation, requiring notification to go through their attorneys.
The victim notification process is being managed through the Victim Notification System (VNS).
The arraignment for Jeffrey Epstein was scheduled for Monday, July 15, 2019, creating urgency for the notifications.
